newsitem.title: USA: Coke offers to buy back common stock.
newsitem.headline: Coke offers to buy back common stock.

text.p: Coca-Cola Bottling Co Consolidated said its board of directors has authorized a Dutch auction self tender offer to purchase for cash up to 500,000 shares of its outstanding common stock.
The company said the offer will begin November 14 and end December 13.
It said the purchase price will be between $42.50 per share and $47.50 in cash.
On November 13, the stock's closing price was $42.25 on the Nasdaq National Market, it said, adding that it had 7,958,059 in stock outstanding.
The company said First Union National Bank of North Carolina was serving as the Depositary for the tender offer, and Georgeson & Company Inc as the information agent.
Coca-Cola Bottling Co Consolidated, headquartered in Charlotte, N.C., is the second largest Coca-Cola bottler in the United States with annual revenues of more than $760 million.
